intro: Bogenhardia tiubae f. perennis, commonly known as the evergreen heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink, typically blooming in late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
